p: The major component of L. viridis leaf oil, bicyclogermacrene, has shown antibacterial activity against B. cereus [ 53]. Likewise, β-pinene was shown to be active against E. faecalis [ 54] as well as several other Gram-positive organisms [ 55]. Similarly, α-pinene has activity against several Gram-positive bacteria [ 55, 56]. Decanal has also exhibited antibacterial activity [ 57, 58]. Thus, the major components of L. viridis leaf essential oil, bicyclogermacrene, decanal, α-pinene, and β-pinene, can account for the observed antibacterial activity.
